      • maxRebuiltIndicesPerTick

        @Deprecated
public int maxRebuiltIndicesPerTick()
        Deprecated. 

      • maxRebuiltIndicesPerTick

        @Deprecated
public WorldConfiguration maxRebuiltIndicesPerTick(int maxRebuiltIndicesPerTick)
        Deprecated. All indices are always rebuilt now. This method has no effect.
        Maximum limit on how many active entity indices are rebuilt each time World.process() is invoked. An index is flagged as dirty whenever an Entity is removed or added to a system.
        Parameters:
        maxRebuiltIndicesPerTick - 0 or more.
        Returns:
        This instance for chaining.

      • register

        public WorldConfiguration register(Object o)
        Manually register object for injection by type. Explicitly annotate to be injected fields with @Wire. A class level @Wire annotation is not enough. Since objects are injected by type, this method is limited to one object per type. Use register(String, Object) to register multiple objects of the same type. Not required for systems and managers.
        Parameters:
        o - object to inject.
        Returns:
        This instance for chaining.

      • register

        public WorldConfiguration register(String name,
                          Object o)
        Manually register object for injection by name. Explicitly annotate to be injected fields with @Wire(name="myName"). A class level @Wire annotation is not enough. Not required for systems and managers.
        Parameters:
        name - unique identifier matching injection site name.
        o - object to inject.
        Returns:
        This instance for chaining.

      • setSystem

        public <T extends BaseSystem> WorldConfiguration setSystem(T system,
                                                  boolean passive)
        Will add a system to this world.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the system class type
        Parameters:
        system - the system to add
        passive - whether or not this system will be processed by World.process()
        Returns:
        the added system

      • setManager

        public final <T extends Manager> WorldConfiguration setManager(Class<T> manager)
        Add a manager into this world.

        It can be retrieved later. World will notify this manager of changes to entity.

        Type Parameters:
        T - class type of the manager
        Parameters:
        manager - manager to be added
        Returns:
        the manager

      • setManager
